intro: Borreria arvensis, commonly known as the field borreria, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is an annual herb that typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers with white to pink petals. Its fruits are small berries that contain seeds dispersed by animals. Borreria arvensis is native to the Americas and is often found in temperate regions.
